sentences.english: My parents speak and act like "old children", often make people laugh.
sentences.chinese: 我父母的说话做事像个“老顽童”，常让人忍俊不禁。

sentences.english: In early morning mist that rolls in from the coast, two brown bears tussle like teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 清晨，雾从海岸边涌来，两只棕熊像顽童般嬉闹。

sentences.english: Before he died just know that perennial of what to look for is situated boy.
sentences.chinese: 死前才知道顽童即是黄教所要寻找的灵童。

sentences.english: Become young again! Its two-leg structure enables it to stand by the wall, and not easily falling down.
sentences.chinese: 老顽童依仗的双腿结构，可随意依墙而放，不易滑倒。

sentences.english: I was then a naughty little child, only yay high.
sentences.chinese: 我那时还是个小顽童，只有这么高。

sentences.english: Welcome all lovely kidults to come, to play and be inspired.
sentences.chinese: 各界可爱大顽童，欢迎前来玩物励志。

sentences.english: Who am I, you old rascal ?
An urchin who had frequently seen him before, stopped to gaze.
sentences.chinese: 一个以前常在那里看见他的顽童，停下来观望着。

sentences.english: When Dan died, the wayward boys he had befriended were among the chief mourners.
sentences.chinese: 丹死时，他曾与之为友的顽童们都在主要悼丧者之列。

definition: smell of mother's milk not yet dried (idiom); immature and inexperienced/still wet behind the ears
